text: I dunno why people are saying it's a rare game, cause it's not. People just claim it is when they're selling it to get a high price. There are thousands of copies out there, but such it's such a GOOD game and there is a high demand, sellers up the price. That is all. Not rare.

author: philip0544

text: The instant Nintendo remasters this game I don't think anyone would hesitate to snatch it up.  In the meantime, nobody really loses anything from emulation, it's not our fault the game is no longer being made and may never be re-made.  There is a limited number of copies out there, but that shouldn't stop people from being able to experience this great game.

author: Pianoninja924

text:
"Emulation = stealing"? From who?

Not from APE, Itoi, or Ninendo, considering that, if you buy an overpriced used cartridge on E-Bay or whatever, they will get ZERO money from the selling.

Get real: Nintendo does NOT want to sell this game again. And I'm not willing to fill some douche's pockets with 250 dollars just because this game is rare. No sir, emulation is fine and everyone should do it - unless Nintendo decides to sell this game again.

text: i feel like buy earthbound of amazon but there one problem  IT'S TO DAM EXPENSIVE! have you ever seen that much money to get this one rare game? it goes from $99.00,$100.00 & $250.00. WTF is wrong with thoose sellers selling a rare rpg game at a high prise? thats bull s**t! they should at lest sell it at lower prise then a higher on.
author: beetle1890

text: Super Mario RPG is another game like that. It isn't rare at all, but people think it is and that causes prices online to jump due to sellers that take advantage of this.
author: ・ω・

text: I admit I'm guilty of that, but I make every effort to buy the games I actually it like; it's just that I don't always have the money for them, especially with games such as Earthbound that get so expensive online. I really don't see what anybody gains from the lack of old emulated games, though. The only people that profit are the people that sell the game for inflated prices based on a central idea that the game is supposed to be rare. The original companies get nothing.
author: ・ω・

text: I can see that, but I still enjoy it's strangeness despite that.
author: ・ω・

text: I'm glad that there's people who's still buying old games that are very good, instead of getting an emulator and play it illegally.
